conclusion: To determine when objects A and B are farthest apart, we need to analyze their velocity-time (v-t) graphs.
The distance between the two objects at any given time is the difference in the areas under their respective v-t graphs from the start time to that given time.
The area under the velocity-time graph represents the displacement of the object.
For object A, the area under the curve from time \( t = 0 \) to \( t = t_2 \) is a triangle.
For object B, the area under the curve from time \( t = 0 \) to \( t = t_2 \) is a combination of a triangle and a curved shape.

conclusion: For object A, the displacement at time \( t_2 \) is the area of the triangle formed by the velocity-time graph.

conclusion: At time \( t_1 \), the displacement of object A is less than that of object B because the area under the curve for object B is larger.
